        "contents": "$users = Database::table('users')\r\n    ->select('id, email')\r\n    ->where(\"role = 'admin'\")\r\n    ->orderBy('created_at DESC')\r\n    ->limit(20)\r\n    ->get();\r\n\r\nforeach ($users as $user) {\r\n    echo $user['email'], PHP_EOL;\r\n}\r\n```\r\n\r\n**Notes**\r\n\r\n- Each call reuses static state.  Reset builder state between queries to avoid\r\n  carrying over clauses.\r\n- `get()` terminates the chain, returning an array of associative arrays.\r\n- On connection failure `get()` prints an error and exits.\r\n\r\n---\r\n\r\n## `Connection\\SQLite`\r\n\r\nMirrors the MySQL API but powered by `PDO`.\r\n\r\n| Method              | Description                                            |\r\n|---------------------|--------------------------------------------------------|\r\n| `SQLite::query($sql)` | Execute raw SQL returning the `PDOStatement`.       |\r\n| `SQLite::table($table)` | Build a SELECT query as with `Database`.          |\r\n| `select`, `where`, `andWhere`, `orderBy`, `limit` | Same semantics as `Database`. |\r\n| `get(): array`      | Returns all rows via `PDO::FETCH_ASSOC`.               |\r\n\r\n```php\r\nuse Connection\\SQLite;\r\n\r\n$posts = SQLite::table('posts')\r\n    ->select('title, body')\r\n    ->orderBy('published_at DESC')\r\n    ->get();\r\n```\r\n\r\n---\r\n\r\n# Controllers (`app/controllers`)\r\n\r\nControllers must be named to match their file.  For example, `app/controllers/html.php`\r\ncontains:\r\n\r\n```php\r\nclass Html extends Controller\r\n{\r\n    public function index(array $params = []): void\r\n    {\r\n        $this->view('home');\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    public function e404(): void\r\n    {\r\n        $this->view('error/404');\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    public function login(): void\r\n    {\r\n        echo \"this is login page\";\r\n    }\r\n}\r\n```\r\n\r\n## Creating New Controllers\r\n\r\n1. Add a lowercase PHP file to `app/controllers`, e.g. `profile.php`.\r\n2. Define a class with the same name but proper casing, extending `Controller`.\r\n3. Implement public methods representing routes.\r\n\r\n```php\r\n// app/controllers/profile.php\r\nclass Profile extends Controller\r\n",
        "originalContents": "$users = Database::table('users')\r\n    ->select('id, email')\r\n    ->where(\"role = 'admin'\")\r\n    ->orderBy('created_at DESC')\r\n    ->limit(20)\r\n    ->get();\r\n\r\nforeach ($users as $user) {\r\n    echo $user['email'], PHP_EOL;\r\n}\r\n```\r\n\r\n**Notes**\r\n\r\n- Each call reuses static state.  Reset builder state between queries to avoid\r\n  carrying over clauses.\r\n- `get()` terminates the chain, returning an array of associative arrays.\r\n- On connection failure `get()` prints an error and exits.\r\n\r\n---\r\n\r\n## `Connection\\SQLite`\r\n\r\nMirrors the MySQL API but powered by `PDO`.\r\n\r\n| Method              | Description                                            |\r\n|---------------------|--------------------------------------------------------|\r\n| `SQLite::query($sql)` | Execute raw SQL returning the `PDOStatement`.       |\r\n| `SQLite::table($table)` | Build a SELECT query as with `Database`.          |\r\n| `select`, `where`, `andWhere`, `orderBy`, `limit` | Same semantics as `Database`. |\r\n| `get(): array`      | Returns all rows via `PDO::FETCH_ASSOC`.               |\r\n\r\n```php\r\nuse Connection\\SQLite;\r\n\r\n$posts = SQLite::table('posts')\r\n    ->select('title, body')\r\n    ->orderBy('published_at DESC')\r\n    ->get();\r\n```\r\n\r\n---\r\n\r\n# Controllers (`app/controllers`)\r\n\r\nControllers must be named to match their file.  For example, `app/controllers/html.php`\r\ncontains:\r\n\r\n```php\r\nclass Html extends Controller\r\n{\r\n    public function index(array $params = []): void\r\n    {\r\n        $this->view('home');\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    public function e404(): void\r\n    {\r\n        $this->view('error/404');\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    public function login(): void\r\n    {\r\n        echo \"this is login page\";\r\n    }\r\n}\r\n```\r\n\r\n## Creating New Controllers\r\n\r\n1. Add a lowercase PHP file to `app/controllers`, e.g. `profile.php`.\r\n2. Define a class with the same name but proper casing, extending `Controller`.\r\n3.           {
            "text": "use Connection\\Database;\r",

          },

          {
            "text": "$users = Database::table('users')\r",

          },

          },

          },
          {

          },

          },

            "text": "\r",
            "lineNumber": 281
          },
          {

            "text": "\r",
            "lineNumber": 286
          },
          {
            "text": "**Notes**\r",
            "lineNumber": 287
          },
          {
            "text": "\r",
            "lineNumber": 288
          },
          {
            "text": "- Each call reuses static state.  Reset builder state between queries to avoid\r",
            "lineNumber": 289
          },
          {
            "text": "  carrying over clauses.\r",
            "lineNumber": 290
          },
          {
            "text": "- `get()` terminates the chain, returning an array of associative arrays.\r",
            "lineNumber": 291
          },
          {
            "text": "- On connection failure `get()` prints an error and exits.\r",
            "lineNumber": 292
          },
          {
            "text": "\r",
            "lineNumber": 293
          },
          {
            "text": "---\r",
            "lineNumber": 294
          },
          {
            "text": "\r",
            "lineNumber": 295
          },
          {
            "text": "## `Connection\\SQLite`\r",
            "lineNumber": 296
          },
          {
            "text": "\r",
            "lineNumber": 297
          },
          {
            "text": "Mirrors the MySQL API but powered by `PDO`.\r",
            "lineNumber": 298
          },
          {
            "text": "\r",
            "lineNumber": 299
          },
          {
            "text": "| Method              | Description                                            |\r",
            "lineNumber": 300
          },
          {
            "text": "|---------------------|--------------------------------------------------------|\r",
            "lineNumber": 301
          },
          {
            "text": "| `SQLite::query($sql)` | Execute raw SQL returning the `PDOStatement`.       |\r",
            "lineNumber": 302
          },
          {
            "text": "| `SQLite::table($table)` | Build a SELECT query as with `Database`.          |\r",
            "lineNumber": 303
          },
          {
            "text": "| `select`, `where`, `andWhere`, `orderBy`, `limit` | Same semantics as `Database`. |\r",
            "lineNumber": 304
          },
          {
            "text": "| `get(): array`      | Returns all rows via `PDO::FETCH_ASSOC`.               |\r",
            "lineNumber": 305
          },
          {
            "text": "\r",
            "lineNumber": 306
          },
          {
            "text": "```php\r",
            "lineNumber": 307
          },
          {
            "text": "use Connection\\SQLite;\r",
            "lineNumber": 308
          },
          {
            "text": "\r",
            "lineNumber": 309
          },
          {
            "text": "$posts = SQLite::table('posts')\r",
            "lineNumber": 310
          },
          {
            "text": "    ->select('title, body')\r",
            "lineNumber": 311
          },
          {
            "text": "    ->orderBy('published_at DESC')\r",
            "lineNumber": 312
          },
          {
            "text": "    ->get();\r",
            "lineNumber": 313
          },
          {
            "text": "```\r",
            "lineNumber": 314
          },
          {
            "text": "\r",
            "lineNumber": 315
          },
          {
            "text": "---\r",
            "lineNumber": 316
          },
          {
            "text": "\r",
            "lineNumber": 317
          },

        "contents": "2. Treat the first segment as controller name.  If the file\r\n   `app/controllers/<controller>.php` exists, set `$controller` accordingly.\r\n3.         "contents": "# Overview\r\n\r\nThis repository contains a lightweight, educational PHP MVC framework intended to\r\ndemonstrate the core pieces of a front-controller style application.  Despite\r\nits size, it exposes a complete set of public APIs for bootstrapping\r\ncontrollers, rendering views, working with assets, and performing basic database\r\nqueries.\r\n\r\nThis document serves as comprehensive reference documentation for every public\r\ncomponent, class, method, and helper function.  Alongside each API you will find\r\nusage details and runnable examples.\r\n\r\n---\r\n\r\n# Quick Start\r\n\r\n```bash\r\ngit clone https://github.com/<you>/php-framework.git\r\ncd php-framework\r\nphp -S localhost:8080\r\n```\r\n\r\nThen browse to <http://localhost:8080/php-framework/>.\r\n\r\nTo customise the base URL or database connection settings edit `config.php`.\r\n\r\n---\r\n\r\n# Application Flow\r\n\r\n1. `index.php` loads configuration (`config.php`) and bootstraps the framework\r\n   via `core/init.php`.\r\n2. `core/init.php` registers the database utilities, model autoloader, and core\r\n   classes.\r\n3. Instantiating `core\\App` reads `$_GET['url']`, resolves a controller class,\r\n   determines the method to invoke, and dispatches the request.\r\n4. Controllers extend `core\\Controller`, which provides helpers for rendering\r\n   views and redirecting unauthenticated users.\r\n5. Views use the global `assets()` helper to reference cache-busted static files\r\n   located beneath `public/`.\r\n\r\n---\r\n\r\n# Configuration (`config.php`)\r\n\r\n| Symbol       | Type   | Description                                                    | Example                              |\r\n|--------------|--------|----------------------------------------------------------------|--------------------------------------|\r\n| `$RewriteBase` | string | Base path the framework is served from. Set to `/` for root deployments. | `/php-framework/`                    |\r\n",

Views use the global `assets()` helper to reference cache-busted static files\r\n   located beneath `public/`.\r\n\r\n---\r\n\r\n# Configuration (`config.php`)\r\n\r\n| Symbol       | Type   | Description                                                    | Example                              |\r\n|--------------|--------|----------------------------------------------------------------|--------------------------------------|\r\n| `$RewriteBase` | string | Base path the framework is served from.             "text": "controllers, rendering views, working with assets, and performing basic database\r",
            "lineNumber": 6
          },
          {
            "text": "queries.\r",
            "lineNumber": 7
          },
          {
            "text": "\r",
            "lineNumber": 8
          },
          {
            "text": "This document serves as comprehensive reference documentation for every public\r",
            "lineNumber": 9
          },
          {
            "text": "component, class, method, and helper function.  Alongside each API you will find\r",
            "lineNumber": 10
          },
          {
            "text": "usage details and runnable examples.\r",
            "lineNumber": 11
          },
          {
            "text": "\r",
            "lineNumber": 12
          },
          {
            "text": "---\r",
            "lineNumber": 13
          },
          {
            "text": "\r",
            "lineNumber": 14
          },
          {
            "text": "# Quick Start\r",
            "lineNumber": 15
          },
          {
            "text": "\r",
            "lineNumber": 16
          },
          {
            "text": "```bash\r",
            "lineNumber": 17
          },
          {
            "text": "git clone https://github.com/<you>/php-framework.git\r",
            "lineNumber": 18
          },
          {
            "text": "cd php-framework\r",
            "lineNumber": 19
          },
          {
            "text": "php -S localhost:8080\r",
            "lineNumber": 20
          },
          {
            "text": "```\r",
            "lineNumber": 21
          },
          {
            "text": "\r",
            "lineNumber": 22
          },
          {
            "text": "Then browse to <http://localhost:8080/php-framework/>.\r",
            "lineNumber": 23
          },
          {
            "text": "\r",
            "lineNumber": 24
          },
          {
            "text": "To customise the base URL or database connection settings edit `config.php`.\r",
            "lineNumber": 25
          },
          {
            "text": "\r",
            "lineNumber": 26
          },
          {
            "text": "---\r",
            "lineNumber": 27
          },
          {
            "text": "\r",
            "lineNumber": 28
          },
          {
            "text": "# Application Flow\r",
            "lineNumber": 29
          },
          {
            "text": "\r",
            "lineNumber": 30
          },
          {
            "text": "1. `index.php` loads configuration (`config.php`) and bootstraps the framework\r",
            "lineNumber": 31
          },
          {
            "text": "   via `core/init.php`.\r",
            "lineNumber": 32
          },
          {
            "text": "2. `core/init.php` registers the database utilities, model autoloader, and core\r",
            "lineNumber": 33
          },
          {
            "text": "   classes.\r",
            "lineNumber": 34
          },
          {
            "text": "3. Instantiating `core\\App` reads `$_GET['url']`, resolves a controller class,\r",
            "lineNumber": 35
          },
          {
            "text": "   determines the method to invoke, and dispatches the request.\r",
            "lineNumber": 36
          },
          {
            "text": "4. Controllers extend `core\\Controller`, which provides helpers for rendering\r",
            "lineNumber": 37
          },
          {
            "text": "   views and redirecting unauthenticated users.\r",
            "lineNumber": 38
          },
          {
            "text": "5. Views use the global `assets()` helper to reference cache-busted static files\r",
            "lineNumber": 39
          },
          {
            "text": "   located beneath `public/`.\r",
            "lineNumber": 40
          },
          {
            "text": "\r",
            "lineNumber": 41
          },
          {
            "text": "---\r",
            "lineNumber": 42
          },
          {
            "text": "\r",
            "lineNumber": 43
          },
          {
            "text": "# Configuration (`config.php`)\r",
            "lineNumber": 44
          },
          {
            "text": "\r",
            "lineNumber": 45
          },
          {
            "text": "| Symbol       | Type   | Description                                                    | Example                              |\r",
            "lineNumber": 46
          },
          {
            "text": "|--------------|--------|----------------------------------------------------------------|--------------------------------------|\r",
            "lineNumber": 47
          },
          {

            "lineNumber": 48
          },
          {
            "text": "| `$database`  | array  | Credentials for the MySQL connection used by `Connection\\Database`. | `[\"host\"=>\"localhost\", â€¦]`           |\r",

## Code optimization summary

### 1. Readability improvements
- Added PHPDoc comments for classes, methods, and functions
- Added inline comments explaining logic
- Improved variable names and code structure
- Added type hints for parameters and return types
- Documented method purposes and parameters

### 2. Debugging and error handling
- Added try-catch blocks with logging
- Integrated Logger throughout for error tracking
- Added validation checks before operations
- Clearer error messages with context
- Logged database connection failures with details
- Added file existence checks before requiring controllers

### 3. Performance optimizations

**Router (`core/router.php`):**
- Cached compiled route patterns to avoid recompiling on each request
- Cleared cache only when routes are reloaded

**Database (`core/database.php`):**
- Separated query building into a dedicated method
- Freed result sets after fetching
- Improved connection error handling
- Added proper resource cleanup

**App (`core/app.php`):**
- Added early breaks in loops when possible
- Improved error handling to prevent unnecessary processing
- Added validation before controller instantiation

**User Model (`app/models/User.php`):**
- Added input validation before database operations
- Proper connection cleanup (close connections)
- Better error handling with fallbacks

**API Controller (`app/controllers/api.php`):**
- Added early returns to avoid unnecessary processing
- Better error handling with logging
- Improved user feedback

### 4. Security improvements
- SQL injection prevention with proper escaping
- Input validation before processing
- Better error messages that don't expose sensitive information

### 5. Code quality
- Consistent code formatting
- Proper exception handling
- Resource cleanup (database connections, result sets)
- Type safety with type hints

The codebase is now:
- Easier to understand with clear documentation
- Easier to debug with comprehensive logging
- More performant with caching and optimizations
- More maintainable with better structure

All changes maintain backward compatibility while improving code quality.

Created a dynamic documentation system. Summary:

## Created documentation system

### 1. **`docs/index.html`**
   - Dynamic HTML that updates based on selected version
   - Version selector dropdown in the top right
   - Sections update automatically when version changes

### 2. **`docs/versions.js`**
   - Version history data structure
   - Includes v1.0.0, v2.0.0, v3.0.0 (planned), and v4.0.0 (planned)
   - Helper functions to get versions, previous version, and version data
   - Each version includes:
     - Version info (number, date, status)
     - What's new list
     - Improvements list
     - Features with descriptions and code examples
     - Comparison data
     - Detailed changelog by component

### 3. **`docs/script.js`**
   - Dynamic version loading
   - Automatic comparison with previous version
   - Version selector initialization
   - Dynamic content rendering (features, comparison table, changelog)
   - Navigation and animations

### 4. **`docs/styles.css`**
   - Updated styles with table-success highlighting
   - Responsive design
   - Animations and transitions

### 5. **`docs/README.md`**
   - Documentation on how to use and extend the system

## Features

### Dynamic version system
- Version dropdown in top right shows all versions
- Selecting a version updates all content
- Automatically compares with the previous version
- Shows "N/A" for v1.0.0 (no previous version)

### Extensible
- Easy to add new versions by editing `versions.js`
- Structure supports any number of versions
- Planned versions can be marked with status

### Smart comparison
- Compares selected version vs previous version
- Highlights improvements in the comparison table
- Shows new features vs existing features

### Content sections
- Overview: What's new and improvements
- Features: Visual cards showing features
- Comparison: Side-by-side table
- Changelog: Timeline of changes by component

## How to add new versions

Edit `docs/versions.js` and add a new entry:

```javascript
'v3.0.0': {
    version: 'v3.0.0',

  "contents": "// Version History Manager\n// This file manages all version data by loading individual version files\n\nconst versionHistory = {};\n\n// Version registry - maps version strings to their data objects\nconst versionRegistry = {\n    'v1.0.0': () => version1_0_0,\n    'v2.0.0': () => version2_0_0,\n    'v3.0.0': () => version3_0_0,\n    'v4.0.0': () => version4_0_0\n};\n\n// Initialize version history from registry\nfunction initializeVersionHistory() {\n    Object.keys(versionRegistry).forEach(version => {\n        try {\n            versionHistory[version] = versionRegistry[version]();\n        } catch (error) {\n            console.error(`Error loading version ${version}:`, error);\n        }\n    });\n}\n\n// Get all versions in order (newest first)\nfunction getAllVersions() {\n    return Object.keys(versionHistory).sort((a, b) => {\n        const aNum = parseInt(a.replace('v', '').split('.')[0]);\n        const bNum = parseInt(b.replace('v', '').split('.')[0]);\n        if (aNum !== bNum) return bNum - aNum;\n        const aMinor = parseInt(a.replace('v', '').split('.')[1]);\n        const bMinor = parseInt(b.replace('v', '').split('.')[1]);\n        if (aMinor !== bMinor) return bMinor - aMinor;\n        return parseInt(b.replace('v', '').split('.')[2]) - parseInt(a.replace('v', '').split('.')[2]);\n    });\n}\n\n// Get previous version\nfunction getPreviousVersion(version) {\n    const versions = getAllVersions();\n    const currentIndex = versions.indexOf(version);\n    return currentIndex < versions.length - 1 ? versions[currentIndex + 1] : null;\n}\n\n// Get version data\nfunction getVersionData(version) {\n    return versionHistory[version] || null;\n}\n\n// Initialize on load\ninitializeVersionHistory();\n"
}

  "contentsAfterEdit": "// Version History Manager\r\n// This file manages all version data by loading individual version files\r\n\r\nconst versionHistory = {};\r\n\r\n// Version registry - maps version strings to their data objects\r\nconst versionRegistry = {\r\n    'v1.0.0': () => version1_0_0,\r\n    'v2.0.0': () => version2_0_0,\r\n    'v3.0.0': () => version3_0_0,\r\n    'v4.0.0': () => version4_0_0\r\n};\r\n\r\n// Initialize version history from registry\r\nfunction initializeVersionHistory() {\r\n    Object.keys(versionRegistry).forEach(version => {\r\n        try {\r\n            versionHistory[version] = versionRegistry[version]();\r\n        } catch (error) {\r\n            console.error(`Error loading version ${version}:`, error);\r\n        }\r\n    });\r\n}\r\n\r\n// Get all versions in order (newest first)\r\nfunction getAllVersions() {\r\n    return Object.keys(versionHistory).sort((a, b) => {\r\n        const aNum = parseInt(a.replace('v', '').split('.')[0]);\r\n        const bNum = parseInt(b.replace('v', '').split('.')[0]);\r\n        if (aNum !== bNum) return bNum - aNum;\r\n        const aMinor = parseInt(a.replace('v', '').split('.')[1]);\r\n        const bMinor = parseInt(b.replace('v', '').split('.')[1]);\r\n        if (aMinor !== bMinor) return bMinor - aMinor;\r\n        return parseInt(b.replace('v', '').split('.')[2]) - parseInt(a.replace('v', '').split('.')[2]);\r\n    });\r\n}\r\n\r\n// Get previous version\r\nfunction getPreviousVersion(version) {\r\n    const versions = getAllVersions();\r\n    const currentIndex = versions.indexOf(version);\r\n    return currentIndex < versions.length - 1 ? versions[currentIndex + 1] : null;\r\n}\r\n\r\n// Get version data\r\nfunction getVersionData(version) {\r\n    return versionHistory[version] || null;\r\n}\r\n\r\n// Initialize on load\r\ninitializeVersionHistory();\r\n"

Register the version in `versions.js`:\n\n```javascript\nconst versionRegistry = {\n    // ... existing versions\n    'v3.0.0': () => version3_0_0\n};\n```\n\n4. Add the script tag to `index.html`:\n\n```html\n<script src=\"versions/v3.0.0.js\"></script>\n```\n\n## Benefits\n\n- **Easy to maintain**: Each version is in its own file\n- **Better organization**: Clear separation of concerns\n- **Version control friendly**: Changes to one version don't affect others\n- **Scalable**: Easy to add new versions without cluttering\n\n## Version Data Structure\n\nEach version file exports a constant with the following structure:\n\n- `version`: Version string (e.g., 'v2.0.0')\n- `releaseDate`: Release date (YYYY-MM-DD format)\n- `status`: 'stable' or 'planned'\n- `description`: Brief description of the version\n- `whatsNew`: Array of new features\n- `improvements`: Array of improvements over previous version\n- `features`: Object with feature details\n- `comparison`: Object with comparison data\n- `changelog`: Array of component changes\n"

## ğŸ¤– Assistant #196 (Agent)

_2025-11-17 11:53:39Z_

Restructured the documentation system so each version has its own file. Summary:

## New file structure

### Version files (separated)
- `docs/versions/v1.0.0.js` - Version 1.0.0 data
- `docs/versions/v2.0.0.js` - Version 2.0.0 data
- `docs/versions/v3.0.0.js` - Version 3.0.0 data (planned)
- `docs/versions/v4.0.0.js` - Version 4.0.0 data (planned)

### Core files
- `docs/versions.js` - Version manager that loads all version files
- `docs/script.js` - Main JavaScript logic
- `docs/index.html` - Updated to load individual version files
- `docs/versions/README.md` - Guide on how to add new versions

## Benefits

### Easier maintenance
- Each version is in its own file
- Edit one version without affecting others
- Clear separation of concerns

### Better organization
- Easy to find specific version data
- Cleaner file structure
- Scalable for many versions

### Version control friendly
- Changes to one version are isolated
- Easier to review diffs
- Better git history

## How to add a new version

1. Create `docs/versions/v3.0.0.js`:
```javascript
const version3_0_0 = {
    version: 'v3.0.0',
    // ... version data
};
```

2. Register in `docs/versions.js`:
```javascript
const versionRegistry = {
    'v3.0.0': () => version3_0_0
};
```

3. Add script tag in `docs/index.html`:
```html
<script src="versions/v3.0.0.js"></script>
```

The system automatically:
- Loads the new version
- Adds it to the dropdown
- Enables comparison with previous versions

Each version is now in its own file for easier management and updates.

Implemented a version-specific tutorial system. Summary:

## Version-specific tutorials

### 1. Tutorial data structure
- Added `tutorials` object to both `v1.0.0.js` and `v2.0.0.js`
- Each tutorial includes:
  - Title
  - Multiple sections with headings, content, code examples, and explanations
  - Version-specific differences highlighted

### 2. Dynamic tutorial loader
- Created `loadTutorial()` function in `script.js` that:
  - Loads tutorial content based on selected version
  - Renders sections dynamically
  - Handles code examples with copy buttons
  - Shows explanations for each section

### 3. Updated tutorial pages
- All tutorial pages now:
  - Display a version badge showing the current version
  - Load content dynamically from version data
  - Support version switching via the dropdown
  - Update URL parameters when version changes

### 4. Version differences
- v1.0.0: Basic tutorials (simpler examples)
- v2.0.0: Enhanced tutorials with:
  - Error handling with Logger
  - Additional sections (e.g., "Route Parameters" in routing)
  - "New in v2.0.0" notes
  - More advanced examples

### 5. Adding new versions
When you add v3.0.0:
1. Create `docs/versions/v3.0.0.js`
2. Add `tutorials` object with version-specific content
3. Tutorials will automatically show v3.0.0 content when selected
4. You can add new tutorials, modify existing ones, or remove tutorials

The system is ready. Tutorials now display version-specific content, and you can easily add or modify tutorials for future versions.

Each route needs a method, path, controller, and action.\n- **Code:**\n  ```php\n  <?php\n  \n  return [\n      'home' => [\n          'method' => 'GET',\n          'path' => '/',\n          'controller' => 'html',\n          'action' => 'index',\n      ],\n      'user.show' => [\n          'method' => 'GET',\n          'path' => '/user/{id}',\n          'controller' => 'user',\n          'action' => 'show',\n      ],\n  ];\n  ```\n- **Explanation:**\n  - `method`: HTTP method (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE)\n  - `path`: URL pattern with optional parameters like `{id}`\n  - `controller`: Controller class name (without .php extension)\n  - `action`: Method name in the controller\n\n### Database\n#### Section: Basic Queries\n- **Heading:** Basic Queries\n- **Content:** The query builder provides a fluent interface for building database queries.\n- **Code:**\n  ```php\n  <?php\n  \n  use Connection\\Database;\n  \n  $users = Database::table('users')->get();\n  \n  $activeUsers = Database::table('users')\n      ->where('status = \"active\"')\n      ->orderBy('created_at DESC')\n      ->limit(10)\n      ->get();\n  ```\n- **Explanation:**\n  - `table('name')`: Sets the table name\n  - `where('condition')`: Adds WHERE clause\n  - `orderBy('column')`: Adds ORDER BY clause\n  - `limit(number)`: Limits the number of results\n  - `get()`: Executes the query and returns array of results\n\n### Validation\n#### Section: Validating Input\n- **Heading:** Validating Input\n- **Content:** Use the validator to validate form data with rules.\n- **Code:**\n  ```php\n  <?php\n  \n  $validator = $this->validate($_POST, [\n      'name' => 'required|min:3|max:50',\n      'email' => 'required|email',\n      'password' => 'required|min:8',\n  ]);\n  \n  if ($validator->fails()) {\n      flash('errors', $validator->errors());\n      return $this->back();\n  }\n  ```\n- **Explanation:**\n  - `required`: Field must be present and not empty\n  - `min:X`: Minimum length for strings\n  - `max:X`: Maximum length for strings\n  - `email`: Must be valid email format\n\n### Views\n#### Section: Rendering Views\n- **Heading:** Rendering Views\n- **Content:** Use the `view()` method to render templates with data.\n- **Code:**\n  ```php\n  <?php\n  \n  class UserController extends Controller\n  {\n      public function show($params)\n      {\n          $user = User::find($params[0]);\n          \n          $this->view('user/show', [\n              'user' => $user,\n              'title' => 'User Profile'\n          ]);\n      }\n  }\n  ```\n- **Explanation:**\n  - Layout files are stored in `app/views/layouts/`\n  - The view content is inserted into `$content` variable\n  - You can set a default layout in the controller\n\n### CSRF\n#### Section: Adding CSRF Token to Forms\n- **Heading:** Adding CSRF Token to Forms\n- **Content:** Protect your forms from CSRF attacks by including a CSRF token.\n- **Code:**\n  ```html\n  <form method=\"POST\" action=\"<?= route('user.store') ?>\">\n      <?= csrf_field() ?>\n      \n      <input type=\"text\" name=\"name\" required>\n      <button type=\"submit\">Submit</button>\n  </form>\n  ```\n- **Explanation:**\n  - `csrf_field()`: Generates a hidden input with the CSRF token\n  - The token is stored in the session and validated on each POST request\n  - If the token doesn't match, the request is rejected\n\n### Upload\n#### Section: Handling File Uploads\n- **Heading:** Handling File Uploads\n- **Content:** Use the Upload class to handle file uploads with validation.\n- **Code:**\n  ```php\n  <?php\n  \n  use Core\\Upload;\n  \n  $file = Upload::make('file')\n      ->allowed(['jpg', 'jpeg', 'png', 'pdf'])\n      ->maxSize(5242880) // 5MB\n      ->path('storage/uploads')\n      ->store();\n  ```\n- **Explanation:**\n  - `make('field')`: Specify the file input name\n  - `allowed(['ext1', 'ext2'])`: Set allowed file extensions\n  - `maxSize(bytes)`: Set maximum file size\n  - `store()`: Saves the file and returns the filename\n\n## Notes\nThis is the initial release of the PHP Framework. All core features are functional but may lack advanced error handling and documentation.\n"

Parameters are defined using `{param}` syntax\r\n  - Parameters are passed to the controller action as an array\r\n  - Access parameters using `$params[0]`, `$params[1]`, etc.\r\n\r\n### Database\r\n#### Section: Basic Queries\r\n- **Heading:** Basic Queries\r\n- **Content:** The query builder provides a fluent interface for building database queries.\r\n- **Code:**\r\n  ```php\r\n  <?php\r\n  \r\n  use Connection\\Database;\r\n  use Core\\Logger;\r\n  \r\n  try {\r\n      $users = Database::table('users')->get();\r\n      \r\n      $activeUsers = Database::table('users')\r\n          ->where('status = \"active\"')\r\n          ->orderBy('created_at DESC')\r\n          ->limit(10)\r\n          ->get();\r\n  } catch (\\Exception $e) {\r\n      Logger::error(\"Database query failed\", ['error' => $e->getMessage()]);\r\n  }\r\n  ```\r\n- **Explanation:**\r\n  - `table('name')`: Sets the table name\r\n  - `where('condition')`: Adds WHERE clause\r\n  - `orderBy('column')`: Adds ORDER BY clause\r\n  - `limit(number)`: Limits the number of results\r\n  - `get()`: Executes the query and returns array of results\r\n  - **New in v2.0.0:** Enhanced error handling with Logger integration\r\n\r\n#### Section: Using Models\r\n- **Heading:** Using Models\r\n- **Content:** Models provide a cleaner interface for database operations with built-in error handling.\r\n- **Code:**\r\n  ```php\r\n  <?php\r\n  \r\n  class UserController extends Controller\r\n  {\r\n      public function show($params)\r\n      {\r\n          $id = $params[0] ?? null;\r\n          \r\n          // Find user by ID with automatic error handling\r\n          $user = User::find($id);\r\n          \r\n          if (!$user) {\r\n              return $this->error('User not found', 404);\r\n          }\r\n          \r\n          return $this->json($user);\r\n      }\r\n  }\r\n  ```\r\n- **Explanation:**\r\n  - Models include built-in error handling and logging\r\n  - Methods return null on failure instead of throwing exceptions\r\n  - All database errors are automatically logged\r\n\r\n### Validation\r\n#### Section: Validating Input\r\n- **Heading:** Validating Input\r\n- **Content:** Use the validator to validate form data with rules. Enhanced with better error handling in v2.0.0.\r\n- **Code:**\r\n  ```php\r\n  <?php\r\n  \r\n  use Core\\Logger;\r\n  \r\n  try {\r\n      $validator = $this->validate($_POST, [\r\n          'name' => 'required|min:3|max:50',\r\n          'email' => 'required|email|unique:users',\r\n          'password' => 'required|min:8|confirmed',\r\n      ]);\r\n      \r\n      if ($validator->fails()) {\r\n          flash('errors', $validator->errors());\r\n          return $this->back();\r\n      }\r\n      \r\n      $data = $validator->validated();\r\n  } catch (\\Exception $e) {\r\n      Logger::error(\"Validation failed\", ['error' => $e->getMessage()]);\r\n  }\r\n  ```\r\n- **Explanation:**\r\n  - `csrf_field()`: Generates a hidden input with the CSRF token automatically\r\n  - The token is stored in the session and validated on each POST request\r\n  - If the token doesn't match, the request is rejected\r\n  - Tokens are regenerated periodically for security\r\n\r\n#### Section: Protecting Routes\r\n- **Heading:** Protecting Routes\r\n- **Content:** Add CSRF middleware to routes that handle form submissions.\r\n- **Code:**\r\n  ```php\r\n  <?php\r\n  \r\n  return [\r\n      'user.store' => [\r\n          'method' => 'POST',\r\n          'path' => '/user',\r\n          'controller' => 'user',\r\n          'action' => 'store',\r\n          'middleware' => ['csrf']  // CSRF protection\r\n      ],\r\n  ];\r\n  ```\r\n- **Explanation:**\r\n  - '/' . $file;\r\n\r\n        if (!file_exists($filePath)) {\r\n            return;\r\n        }\r\n\r\n        $lines = file($filePath, FILE_IGNORE_NEW_LINES | FILE_SKIP_EMPTY_LINES);\r\n\r\n        foreach ($lines as $line) {\r\n            if (strpos(trim($line), '#') === 0) {\r\n                continue;\r\n            }\r\n\r\n            if (strpos($line, '=') === false) {\r\n                continue;\r\n            }\r\n\r\n            [$key, $value] = explode('=', $line, 2);\r\n            $key = trim($key);\r\n            $value = trim($value);\r\n\r\n            // Remove quotes if present\r\n            if (preg_match('/^\"(.*)\"$/', $value, $matches)) {\r\n                $value = $matches[1];\r\n            } elseif (preg_match(\"/^'(.*)'$/\", $value, $matches)) {\r\n                $value = $matches[1];\r\n            }\r\n\r\n            if (!array_key_exists($key, $_SERVER) && !array_key_exists($key, $_ENV)) {\r\n                putenv(\"$key=$value\");\r\n                $_ENV[$key] = $value;\r\n                $_SERVER[$key] = $value;\r\n            }\r\n\r\n            self::$cache[$key] = $value;\r\n        }\r\n\r\n        self::$loaded = true;\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    public static function get(string $key, $default = null)\r\n    {\r\n        $value = getenv($key);\r\n\r\n        if ($value === false) {\r\n            return $default;\r\n        }\r\n\r\n        // Convert string booleans\r\n        if (strtolower($value) === 'true') {\r\n            return true;\r\n        }\r\n        if (strtolower($value) === 'false') {\r\n            return false;\r\n        }\r\n\r\n        // Convert numeric strings\r\n        if (is_numeric($value)) {\r\n            return strpos($value, '.') !== false ? (float)$value : (int)$value;\r\n        }\r\n\r\n        return $value;\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    public static function has(string $key): bool\r\n    {\r\n        return getenv($key) !== false;\r\n    }\r\n}\r\n\r\n",

{
  "contents": "# Overview\r\n\r\nThis repository contains a lightweight, educational PHP MVC framework intended to\r\ndemonstrate the core pieces of a front-controller style application.  Despite\r\nits size, it exposes a complete set of public APIs for bootstrapping\r\ncontrollers, rendering views, working with assets, and performing basic database\r\nqueries.\r\n\r\nThis document serves as comprehensive reference documentation for every public\r\ncomponent, class, method, and helper function.  Alongside each API you will find\r\nusage details and runnable examples.\r\n\r\n---\r\n\r\n# Quick Start\r\n\r\n```bash\r\ngit clone https://github.com/<you>/php-framework.git\r\ncd php-framework\r\nphp -S localhost:8080\r\n```\r\n\r\nThen browse to <http://localhost:8080/php-framework/>.\r\n\r\nTo customise the base URL or database connection settings edit `config.php`.\r\n\r\n---\r\n\r\n# Application Flow\r\n\r\n1. `index.php` loads configuration (`config.php`) and bootstraps the framework\r\n   via `core/init.php`.\r\n2. `core/init.php` registers the database utilities, model autoloader, and core\r\n   classes.\r\n3. Instantiating `core\\App` reads `$_GET['url']`, resolves a controller class,\r\n   determines the method to invoke, and dispatches the request.\r\n4. Controllers extend `core\\Controller`, which provides helpers for rendering\r\n   views and redirecting unauthenticated users.\r\n5. Views use the global `assets()` helper to reference cache-busted static files\r\n   located beneath `public/`.\r\n\r\n---\r\n\r\n# Configuration (`config.php`)\r\n\r\n| Symbol       | Type   | Description                                                    | Example                              |\r\n|--------------|--------|----------------------------------------------------------------|--------------------------------------|\r\n| `$RewriteBase` | string | Base path the framework is served from. Set to `/` for root deployments. | `/php-framework/`                    |\r\n| `$database`  | array  | Credentials for the MySQL connection used by `Connection\\Database`. | `[\"host\"=>\"localhost\", â€¦]`           |\r\n| `$SQLite`    | string | Path to the SQLite database file used by `Connection\\SQLite`.  | `test.sqlite`                        |\r\n\r\n---\r\n\r\n# Helper Functions\r\n\r\n## `assets(string $relativePath): string`\r\n\r\nBuilds a public URL for an asset stored beneath `public/`. When the referenced\r\nfile exists, the helper appends a `v=<timestamp>` query parameter derived from\r\n`filemtime`, enabling long-lived caching with automatic busting on deploys.\r\n\r\n**Usage**\r\n\r\n```php\r\n<link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"<?= assets('css/style.css') ?>\">\r\n<script src=\"<?= assets('js/app.js') ?>\" defer></script>\r\n```\r\n\r\n**Behaviour**\r\n\r\n- Mirrors the configured `$RewriteBase`.\r\n- Returns the original URL when the file cannot be found (still useful for CDN\r\n  hosted assets).\r\n\r\n---\r\n\r\n# Core Classes\r\n\r\n## `core\\App`\r\n\r\n`App` is the front controller.  Construction of this class dispatches the\r\ncurrent HTTP request.\r\n\r\n### Properties\r\n\r\n| Property       | Access | Description                                                                      |\r\n|----------------|--------|----------------------------------------------------------------------------------|\r\n| `$controller`  | protected | Name of the active controller (defaults to `html`).                          |\r\n| `$method`      | protected | Method to invoke on the controller (defaults to `index`).                    |\r\n| `$params`      | protected | Sequential numeric array of remaining URL segments passed to the method.     |\r\n\r\n### Public API\r\n\r\n#### `__construct(): void`\r\n\r\nParses the request URL, resolves the controller and method, and executes the\r\ntarget method via `call_user_func_array`.  This method is invoked implicitly\r\nfrom `index.php`.\r\n\r\n**Dispatch Algorithm**\r\n\r\n1. Call `parseUrl()` to split `$_GET['url']` into path segments.\r\n2. Treat the first segment as controller name.  If the file\r\n   `app/controllers/<controller>.php` exists, set `$controller` accordingly.\r\n3. Include the controller file and instantiate the class.\r\n4. If the next segment matches a public method on the controller, select it.\r\n5. Any additional segments are passed to the method as a single array argument.\r\n\r\n```php\r\n// index.php\r\nrequire_once 'core/init.php';\r\n$app = new App(); // dispatches immediately\r\n```\r\n\r\n#### `parseUrl(): ?array`\r\n\r\nReads the `url` query parameter, trims trailing slashes, sanitises it with\r\n`FILTER_SANITIZE_URL`, and splits it into an array of segments.  Returns `null`\r\nwhen no `url` query string is provided.\r\n\r\n```php\r\n// Given: http://localhost/php-framework/html/show/123\r\n// $_GET['url'] === 'html/show/123'\r\n$segments = $app->parseUrl(); // ['html', 'show', '123']\r\n```\r\n\r\n### URL Routing Examples\r\n\r\n| URL path                                   | Controller | Method | Parameters (array)   |\r\n|--------------------------------------------|------------|--------|----------------------|\r\n| `/html/test1/params1/params2/params3`      | `html`     | `test1`| `['params1', â€¦]`     |\r\n| `/test1/params1/params2/params3`           | `html`     | `test1`| `['params1', â€¦]`     |\r\n| `/`                                        | `html`     | `index`| `[]`                  |\r\n\r\n_Note_: Controller filenames must be lowercase (`html.php`) while class names\r\nuse standard PHP casing (`Html`).\r\n\r\n---\r\n\r\n## `core\\Controller`\r\n\r\nBase class for application controllers located in `app/controllers`.  Extend\r\nthis class to gain access to view rendering and authentication helpers.\r\n\r\n### Public Methods\r\n\r\n#### `view(string $view, array $data = []): void`\r\n\r\nIncludes `app/views/<view>.php`.  Use `$data` to pass variables by extracting\r\nthem prior to inclusion (custom extraction logic can be added in your own\r\ncontroller).\r\n\r\n```php\r\nclass Html extends Controller\r\n{\r\n    public function index(): void\r\n    {\r\n        $data = ['headline' => 'Welcome!'];\r\n        extract($data);\r\n        $this->view('home');\r\n    }\r\n}\r\n```\r\n\r\n#### `error_404(): void`\r\n\r\nSends a simple â€œNot found 404â€ response.  Controllers can call this to handle\r\nunresolvable resources.\r\n\r\n```php\r\npublic function show(array $params): void\r\n{\r\n    if (!$model->exists($params[0] ?? null)) {\r\n        $this->error_404();\r\n        return;\r\n    }\r\n}\r\n```\r\n\r\n#### `is_auth(): void`\r\n\r\nRedirects to the `login` route when the current session lacks both `email` and\r\n`password` entries.\r\n\r\n```php\r\npublic function dashboard(): void\r\n{\r\n    $this->is_auth(); // redirect unauthenticated users\r\n    $this->view('dashboard');\r\n}\r\n```\r\n\r\n---\r\n\r\n## `core\\Post`\r\n\r\nUtility class for sanitising POST input with an optional minimum length\r\nconstraint.  Designed for fluent usage.\r\n\r\n### Public Static Methods\r\n\r\n| Method                             | Description                                                |\r\n|------------------------------------|------------------------------------------------------------|\r\n| `require(string $key): Post`       | Sanitises `$_POST[$key]` if present, storing the result.   |\r\n| `limit(int $length): void`         | Sets the minimum acceptable string length.                 |\r\n| `get(): ?string`                   | Returns the processed value or an error message.           |\r\n\r\n**Example**\r\n\r\n```php\r\nPost::limit(5);\r\n$username = Post::require('username')->get();\r\n\r\nif ($username === \"value is limited only to 5\") {\r\n    // handle validation error\r\n}\r\n```\r\n\r\n_Note_: The current implementation compares the POST value length using\r\n`strlen(Post::$var >= Post::$limit)` which resolves to a boolean.  Adjust for\r\nproper validation as needed.\r\n\r\n---\r\n\r\n## `core\\Auth`\r\n\r\nSimple session checker exposed as `Auth::user()`.\r\n\r\n### `Auth::user(): bool`\r\n\r\nReturns `true` when both `$_SESSION['email']` and `$_SESSION['password']` are\r\nset; otherwise `false`.\r\n\r\n```php\r\nif (Auth::user()) {\r\n    // show dashboard\r\n} else {\r\n    // show login form\r\n}\r\n```\r\n\r\n---\r\n\r\n# Database Layer (`core/database.php`)\r\n\r\nNamespaced under `Connection`.  Two static query builders are provided: one for\r\nMySQL (via `mysqli`) and one for SQLite (via `PDO`).  Both expose a minimal,\r\nchainable API intended for demonstrative purposes.\r\n\r\n## `Connection\\Database`\r\n\r\n### Constructor\r\n\r\n- `__construct()`: Reads `$database` from `config.php` and stores credentials in\r\n  static properties.  Instantiated automatically when chaining methods.\r\n\r\n### Fluent Query API\r\n\r\n| Method                    | Purpose                                           | Example                              |\r\n|---------------------------|---------------------------------------------------|--------------------------------------|\r\n| `Database::query($sql)`   | Run a raw SQL statement.                          | `Database::query(\"SELECT 1\")->get();` |\r\n| `Database::table($name)`  | Begin building a SELECT statement for the table.  | `Database::table('users')`           |\r\n| `select($columns)`        | Set the columns clause (defaults to `*`).         | `->select('id, email')`              |\r\n| `where($condition)`       | Append a `WHERE` clause.                          | `->where(\"id = 5\")`                  |\r\n| `andWhere($condition)`    | Append additional `AND` clauses.                  | `->andWhere(\"status = 'active'\")`    |\r\n| `orderBy($order)`         | Append an `ORDER BY` clause.                      | `->orderBy('created_at DESC')`       |\r\n| `limit($limit)`           | Append a `LIMIT` clause.                          | `->limit(10)`                        |\r\n| `get(): array`            | Execute the built query and return associative rows. | `Database::table('users')->get();` |\r\n\r\n**Complete Example**\r\n\r\n```php\r\nuse Connection\\Database;\r\n\r\n$users = Database::table('users')\r\n    ->select('id, email')\r\n    ->where(\"role = 'admin'\")\r\n    ->orderBy('created_at DESC')\r\n    ->limit(20)\r\n    ->get();\r\n\r\nforeach ($users as $user) {\r\n    echo $user['email'], PHP_EOL;\r\n}\r\n```\r\n\r\n**Notes**\r\n\r\n- Each call reuses static state.  Reset builder state between queries to avoid\r\n  carrying over clauses.\r\n- `get()` terminates the chain, returning an array of associative arrays.\r\n- On connection failure `get()` prints an error and exits.\r\n\r\n---\r\n\r\n## `Connection\\SQLite`\r\n\r\nMirrors the MySQL API but powered by `PDO`.\r\n\r\n| Method              | Description                                            |\r\n|---------------------|--------------------------------------------------------|\r\n| `SQLite::query($sql)` | Execute raw SQL returning the `PDOStatement`.       |\r\n| `SQLite::table($table)` | Build a SELECT query as with `Database`.          |\r\n| `select`, `where`, `andWhere`, `orderBy`, `limit` | Same semantics as `Database`. |\r\n| `get(): array`      | Returns all rows via `PDO::FETCH_ASSOC`.               |\r\n\r\n```php\r\nuse Connection\\SQLite;\r\n\r\n$posts = SQLite::table('posts')\r\n    ->select('title, body')\r\n    ->orderBy('published_at DESC')\r\n    ->get();\r\n```\r\n\r\n---\r\n\r\n# Controllers (`app/controllers`)\r\n\r\nControllers must be named to match their file.  For example, `app/controllers/html.php`\r\ncontains:\r\n\r\n```php\r\nclass Html extends Controller\r\n{\r\n    public function index(array $params = []): void\r\n    {\r\n        $this->view('home');\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    public function e404(): void\r\n    {\r\n        $this->view('error/404');\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    public function login(): void\r\n    {\r\n        echo \"this is login page\";\r\n    }\r\n}\r\n```\r\n\r\n## Creating New Controllers\r\n\r\n1. Add a lowercase PHP file to `app/controllers`, e.g. `profile.php`.\r\n2. Define a class with the same name but proper casing, extending `Controller`.\r\n3. Implement public methods representing routes.\r\n\r\n```php\r\n// app/controllers/profile.php\r\nclass Profile extends Controller\r\n{\r\n    public function show(array $params): void\r\n    {\r\n        $userId = $params[0] ?? null;\r\n        // Load user, then render a view\r\n        $this->view('profile/show');\r\n    }\r\n}\r\n```\r\n\r\nVisiting `/profile/show/42` invokes `Profile::show(['42'])`.\r\n\r\n---\r\n\r\n# Views (`app/views`)\r\n\r\n- Views are raw PHP templates and can call helper functions directly.\r\n- Store shared layouts or partials as additional PHP files and include them.\r\n- Use `assets()` to load CSS/JS from `public/`.\r\n\r\n```php\r\n<!DOCTYPE html>\r\n<html lang=\"en\">\r\n<head>\r\n    <meta charset=\"UTF-8\">\r\n    <link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"<?= assets('css/style.css') ?>\">\r\n</head>\r\n<body>\r\n    <h1><?= htmlspecialchars($headline ?? 'Hello') ?></h1>\r\n    <script src=\"<?= assets('js/app.js') ?>\" defer></script>\r\n</body>\r\n</html>\r\n```\r\n\r\n---\r\n\r\n# Models (`app/models`)\r\n\r\nAn autoloader (`spl_autoload_register`) loads any PHP class placed under\r\n`app/models`.  Use this directory to create domain objects or repositories that\r\nleverage `Connection\\Database` or `Connection\\SQLite`.\r\n\r\n```php\r\n// app/models/User.php\r\nuse Connection\\Database;\r\n\r\nclass User\r\n{\r\n    public static function all(): array\r\n    {\r\n        return Database::table('users')->get();\r\n    }\r\n}\r\n```\r\n\r\n---\r\n\r\n# Static Assets (`public/`)\r\n\r\nPlace CSS, JavaScript, images, and other publicly accessible files beneath\r\n`public/`.  The directory structure is mirrored when generating URLs via\r\n`assets()`.\r\n\r\n```\r\npublic/\r\nâ”œâ”€â”€ css/\r\nâ”‚   â””â”€â”€ style.css\r\nâ””â”€â”€ js/\r\n    â”œâ”€â”€ app.js\r\n    â””â”€â”€ vendor/\r\n```\r\n\r\nDeploy static assets using your web server of choice; the PHP helper only\r\ngenerates URLs.\r\n\r\n---\r\n\r\n# Extending the Framework\r\n\r\n- **Routing**: Modify `App::parseUrl()` or introduce a router layer before\r\n  instantiating controllers.\r\n- **Middleware**: Override controller constructors and invoke shared logic before\r\n  handling requests.\r\n- **Templating**: Wrap `Controller::view()` to inject variables or integrate a\r\n  third-party template engine.\r\n- **Validation**: Expand `Post` to support richer validation rules and error\r\n  collection.\r\n- **Security**: Ensure session handling (`session_start()`) is in place, add CSRF\r\n  protection, and sanitise database inputs with prepared statements for\r\n  production use.\r\n\r\n---\r\n\r\n# Troubleshooting\r\n\r\n| Symptom                                      | Likely Cause / Fix                                           |\r\n|----------------------------------------------|--------------------------------------------------------------|\r\n| Always redirected to `index` method          | Ensure controller file exists and class name matches file.   |\r\n| Assets returning 404                          | Verify `RewriteBase` and that files sit under `public/`.     |\r\n| Persistent DB filters between queries        | Manually reset `Database::$where`, `$andWhere`, etc.         |\r\n| â€œFailed to connect to MySQLâ€                 | Confirm credentials in `config.php` and that MySQL is running.|\r\n\r\n---\r\n\r\n# License\r\n\r\nThis project is provided as-is for educational purposes.   "contentsAfterEdit": "# Overview\r\n\r\nThis repository contains a lightweight, educational PHP MVC framework intended to\r\ndemonstrate the core pieces of a front-controller style application.  Despite\r\nits size, it exposes a complete set of public APIs for bootstrapping\r\ncontrollers, rendering views, working with assets, and performing basic database\r\nqueries.\r\n\r\nThis document serves as comprehensive reference documentation for every public\r\ncomponent, class, method, and helper function.  Alongside each API you will find\r\nusage details and runnable examples.\r\n\r\n## ğŸ“š Documentation\r\n\r\n**Live Documentation:** [View Documentation](https://erselmetz.github.io/php-framework-docs/)\r\n\r\nThe complete documentation including version history, tutorials, and code examples is available online.\r\n\r\n---\r\n\r\n# Quick Start\r\n\r\n```bash\r\ngit clone https://github.com/<you>/php-framework.git\r\ncd php-framework\r\nphp -S localhost:8080\r\n```\r\n\r\nThen browse to <http://localhost:8080/php-framework/>.\r\n\r\nTo customise the base URL or database connection settings edit `config.php`.\r\n\r\n---\r\n\r\n# Application Flow\r\n\r\n1. `index.php` loads configuration (`config.php`) and bootstraps the framework\r\n   via `core/init.php`.\r\n2. `core/init.php` registers the database utilities, model autoloader, and core\r\n   classes.\r\n3. Instantiating `core\\App` reads `$_GET['url']`, resolves a controller class,\r\n   determines the method to invoke, and dispatches the request.\r\n4. Controllers extend `core\\Controller`, which provides helpers for rendering\r\n   views and redirecting unauthenticated users.\r\n5. Views use the global `assets()` helper to reference cache-busted static files\r\n   located beneath `public/`.\r\n\r\n---\r\n\r\n# Configuration (`config.php`)\r\n\r\n| Symbol       | Type   | Description                                                    | Example                              |\r\n|--------------|--------|----------------------------------------------------------------|--------------------------------------|\r\n| `$RewriteBase` | string | Base path the framework is served from. Set to `/` for root deployments. | `/php-framework/`                    |\r\n| `$database`  | array  | Credentials for the MySQL connection used by `Connection\\Database`. | `[\"host\"=>\"localhost\", â€¦]`           |\r\n| `$SQLite`    | string | Path to the SQLite database file used by `Connection\\SQLite`.  | `test.sqlite`                        |\r\n\r\n---\r\n\r\n# Helper Functions\r\n\r\n## `assets(string $relativePath): string`\r\n\r\nBuilds a public URL for an asset stored beneath `public/`. When the referenced\r\nfile exists, the helper appends a `v=<timestamp>` query parameter derived from\r\n`filemtime`, enabling long-lived caching with automatic busting on deploys.\r\n\r\n**Usage**\r\n\r\n```php\r\n<link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"<?= assets('css/style.css') ?>\">\r\n<script src=\"<?= assets('js/app.js') ?>\" defer></script>\r\n```\r\n\r\n**Behaviour**\r\n\r\n- Mirrors the configured `$RewriteBase`.\r\n- Returns the original URL when the file cannot be found (still useful for CDN\r\n  hosted assets).\r\n\r\n---\r\n\r\n# Core Classes\r\n\r\n## `core\\App`\r\n\r\n`App` is the front controller.  Construction of this class dispatches the\r\ncurrent HTTP request.\r\n\r\n### Properties\r\n\r\n| Property       | Access | Description                                                                      |\r\n|----------------|--------|----------------------------------------------------------------------------------|\r\n| `$controller`  | protected | Name of the active controller (defaults to `html`).                          |\r\n| `$method`      | protected | Method to invoke on the controller (defaults to `index`).                    |\r\n| `$params`      | protected | Sequential numeric array of remaining URL segments passed to the method.     |\r\n\r\n### Public API\r\n\r\n#### `__construct(): void`\r\n\r\nParses the request URL, resolves the controller and method, and executes the\r\ntarget method via `call_user_func_array`.  This method is invoked implicitly\r\nfrom `index.php`.\r\n\r\n**Dispatch Algorithm**\r\n\r\n1. Call `parseUrl()` to split `$_GET['url']` into path segments.\r\n2. Treat the first segment as controller name.  If the file\r\n   `app/controllers/<controller>.php` exists, set `$controller` accordingly.\r\n3. Include the controller file and instantiate the class.\r\n4. If the next segment matches a public method on the controller, select it.\r\n5. Any additional segments are passed to the method as a single array argument.\r\n\r\n```php\r\n// index.php\r\nrequire_once 'core/init.php';\r\n$app = new App(); // dispatches immediately\r\n```\r\n\r\n#### `parseUrl(): ?array`\r\n\r\nReads the `url` query parameter, trims trailing slashes, sanitises it with\r\n`FILTER_SANITIZE_URL`, and splits it into an array of segments.  Returns `null`\r\nwhen no `url` query string is provided.\r\n\r\n```php\r\n// Given: http://localhost/php-framework/html/show/123\r\n// $_GET['url'] === 'html/show/123'\r\n$segments = $app->parseUrl(); // ['html', 'show', '123']\r\n```\r\n\r\n### URL Routing Examples\r\n\r\n| URL path                                   | Controller | Method | Parameters (array)   |\r\n|--------------------------------------------|------------|--------|----------------------|\r\n| `/html/test1/params1/params2/params3`      | `html`     | `test1`| `['params1', â€¦]`     |\r\n| `/test1/params1/params2/params3`           | `html`     | `test1`| `['params1', â€¦]`     |\r\n| `/`                                        | `html`     | `index`| `[]`                  |\r\n\r\n_Note_: Controller filenames must be lowercase (`html.php`) while class names\r\nuse standard PHP casing (`Html`).\r\n\r\n---\r\n\r\n## `core\\Controller`\r\n\r\nBase class for application controllers located in `app/controllers`.  Extend\r\nthis class to gain access to view rendering and authentication helpers.\r\n\r\n### Public Methods\r\n\r\n#### `view(string $view, array $data = []): void`\r\n\r\nIncludes `app/views/<view>.php`.  Use `$data` to pass variables by extracting\r\nthem prior to inclusion (custom extraction logic can be added in your own\r\ncontroller).\r\n\r\n```php\r\nclass Html extends Controller\r\n{\r\n    public function index(): void\r\n    {\r\n        $data = ['headline' => 'Welcome!'];\r\n        extract($data);\r\n        $this->view('home');\r\n    }\r\n}\r\n```\r\n\r\n#### `error_404(): void`\r\n\r\nSends a simple â€œNot found 404â€ response.  Controllers can call this to handle\r\nunresolvable resources.\r\n\r\n```php\r\npublic function show(array $params): void\r\n{\r\n    if (!$model->exists($params[0] ?? null)) {\r\n        $this->error_404();\r\n        return;\r\n    }\r\n}\r\n```\r\n\r\n#### `is_auth(): void`\r\n\r\nRedirects to the `login` route when the current session lacks both `email` and\r\n`password` entries.\r\n\r\n```php\r\npublic function dashboard(): void\r\n{\r\n    $this->is_auth(); // redirect unauthenticated users\r\n    $this->view('dashboard');\r\n}\r\n```\r\n\r\n---\r\n\r\n## `core\\Post`\r\n\r\nUtility class for sanitising POST input with an optional minimum length\r\nconstraint.  Designed for fluent usage.\r\n\r\n### Public Static Methods\r\n\r\n| Method                             | Description                                                |\r\n|------------------------------------|------------------------------------------------------------|\r\n| `require(string $key): Post`       | Sanitises `$_POST[$key]` if present, storing the result.   |\r\n| `limit(int $length): void`         | Sets the minimum acceptable string length.                 |\r\n| `get(): ?string`                   | Returns the processed value or an error message.           |\r\n\r\n**Example**\r\n\r\n```php\r\nPost::limit(5);\r\n$username = Post::require('username')->get();\r\n\r\nif ($username === \"value is limited only to 5\") {\r\n    // handle validation error\r\n}\r\n```\r\n\r\n_Note_: The current implementation compares the POST value length using\r\n`strlen(Post::$var >= Post::$limit)` which resolves to a boolean.  Adjust for\r\nproper validation as needed.\r\n\r\n---\r\n\r\n## `core\\Auth`\r\n\r\nSimple session checker exposed as `Auth::user()`.\r\n\r\n### `Auth::user(): bool`\r\n\r\nReturns `true` when both `$_SESSION['email']` and `$_SESSION['password']` are\r\nset; otherwise `false`.\r\n\r\n```php\r\nif (Auth::user()) {\r\n    // show dashboard\r\n} else {\r\n    // show login form\r\n}\r\n```\r\n\r\n---\r\n\r\n# Database Layer (`core/database.php`)\r\n\r\nNamespaced under `Connection`.  Two static query builders are provided: one for\r\nMySQL (via `mysqli`) and one for SQLite (via `PDO`).  Both expose a minimal,\r\nchainable API intended for demonstrative purposes.\r\n\r\n## `Connection\\Database`\r\n\r\n### Constructor\r\n\r\n- `__construct()`: Reads `$database` from `config.php` and stores credentials in\r\n  static properties. For example, `app/controllers/html.php`\r\ncontains:\r\n\r\n```php\r\nclass Html extends Controller\r\n{\r\n    public function index(array $params = []): void\r\n    {\r\n        $this->view('home');\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    public function e404(): void\r\n    {\r\n        $this->view('error/404');\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    public function login(): void\r\n    {\r\n        echo \"this is login page\";\r\n    }\r\n}\r\n```\r\n\r\n## Creating New Controllers\r\n\r\n1. Add a lowercase PHP file to `app/controllers`, e.g. `profile.php`.\r\n2. Define a class with the same name but proper casing, extending `Controller`.\r\n3. Implement public methods representing routes.\r\n\r\n```php\r\n// app/controllers/profile.php\r\nclass Profile extends Controller\r\n{\r\n    public function show(array $params): void\r\n    {\r\n        $userId = $params[0] ?? null;\r\n        // Load user, then render a view\r\n        $this->view('profile/show');\r\n    }\r\n}\r\n```\r\n\r\nVisiting `/profile/show/42` invokes `Profile::show(['42'])`.\r\n\r\n---\r\n\r\n# Views (`app/views`)\r\n\r\n- Views are raw PHP templates and can call helper functions directly.\r\n- Store shared layouts or partials as additional PHP files and include them.\r\n- Use `assets()` to load CSS/JS from `public/`.\r\n\r\n```php\r\n<!DOCTYPE html>\r\n<html lang=\"en\">\r\n<head>\r\n    <meta charset=\"UTF-8\">\r\n    <link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"<?= assets('css/style.css') ?>\">\r\n</head>\r\n<body>\r\n    <h1><?= htmlspecialchars($headline ?? 'Hello') ?></h1>\r\n    <script src=\"<?= assets('js/app.js') ?>\" defer></script>\r\n</body>\r\n</html>\r\n```\r\n\r\n---\r\n\r\n# Models (`app/models`)\r\n\r\nAn autoloader (`spl_autoload_register`) loads any PHP class placed under\r\n`app/models`.  Use this directory to create domain objects or repositories that\r\nleverage `Connection\\Database` or `Connection\\SQLite`.\r\n\r\n```php\r\n// app/models/User.php\r\nuse Connection\\Database;\r\n\r\nclass User\r\n{\r\n    public static function all(): array\r\n    {\r\n        return Database::table('users')->get();\r\n    }\r\n}\r\n```\r\n\r\n---\r\n\r\n# Static Assets (`public/`)\r\n\r\nPlace CSS, JavaScript, images, and other publicly accessible files beneath\r\n`public/`.  The directory structure is mirrored when generating URLs via\r\n`assets()`.\r\n\r\n```\r\npublic/\r\nâ”œâ”€â”€ css/\r\nâ”‚   â””â”€â”€ style.css\r\nâ””â”€â”€ js/\r\n    â”œâ”€â”€ app.js\r\n    â””â”€â”€ vendor/\r\n```\r\n\r\nDeploy static assets using your web server of choice; the PHP helper only\r\ngenerates URLs.\r\n\r\n---\r\n\r\n# Extending the Framework\r\n\r\n- **Routing**: Modify `App::parseUrl()` or introduce a router layer before\r\n  instantiating controllers.\r\n- **Middleware**: Override controller constructors and invoke shared logic before\r\n  handling requests.\r\n- **Templating**: Wrap `Controller::view()` to inject variables or integrate a\r\n  third-party template engine.\r\n- **Validation**: Expand `Post` to support richer validation rules and error\r\n  collection.\r\n- **Security**: Ensure session handling (`session_start()`) is in place, add CSRF\r\n  protection, and sanitise database inputs with prepared statements for\r\n  production use.\r\n\r\n---\r\n\r\n# Troubleshooting\r\n\r\n| Symptom                                      | Likely Cause / Fix                                           |\r\n|----------------------------------------------|--------------------------------------------------------------|\r\n| Always redirected to `index` method          | Ensure controller file exists and class name matches file.   |\r\n| Assets returning 404                          | Verify `RewriteBase` and that files sit under `public/`.     |\r\n| Persistent DB filters between queries        | Manually reset `Database::$where`, `$andWhere`, etc.         |\r\n| â€œFailed to connect to MySQLâ€                 | Confirm credentials in `config.php` and that MySQL is running.|\r\n\r\n---\r\n\r\n# License\r\n\r\nThis project is provided as-is for educational purposes.         "contents": "Includes `app/views/<view>.php`.  Use `$data` to pass variables by extracting\r\nthem prior to inclusion (custom extraction logic can be added in your own\r\ncontroller).\r\n\r\n```php\r\nclass Html extends Controller\r\n{\r\n    public function index(): void\r\n    {\r\n        $data = ['headline' => 'Welcome!'];\r\n        extract($data);\r\n        $this->view('home');\r\n    }\r\n}\r\n```\r\n\r\n#### `error_404(): void`\r\n\r\nSends a simple â€œNot found 404â€ response.  Controllers can call this to handle\r\nunresolvable resources.\r\n\r\n```php\r\npublic function show(array $params): void\r\n{\r\n    if (!$model->exists($params[0] ?? null)) {\r\n        $this->error_404();\r\n        return;\r\n    }\r\n}\r\n```\r\n\r\n#### `is_auth(): void`\r\n\r\nRedirects to the `login` route when the current session lacks both `email` and\r\n`password` entries.\r\n\r\n```php\r\npublic function dashboard(): void\r\n{\r\n    $this->is_auth(); // redirect unauthenticated users\r\n    $this->view('dashboard');\r\n}\r\n```\r\n\r\n---\r\n\r\n## `core\\Post`\r\n\r\nUtility class for sanitising POST input with an optional minimum length\r\nconstraint.  Designed for fluent usage.\r\n\r\n### Public Static Methods\r\n\r\n| Method                             | Description                                                |\r\n|------------------------------------|------------------------------------------------------------|\r\n| `require(string $key): Post`       | Sanitises `$_POST[$key]` if present, storing the result.   |\r\n| `limit(int $length): void`         | Sets the minimum acceptable string length.                 |\r\n| `get(): ?string`                   | Returns the processed value or an error message.           |\r\n\r\n**Example**\r\n\r\n```php\r\nPost::limit(5);\r\n$username = Post::require('username')->get();\r\n\r\nif ($username === \"value is limited only to 5\") {\r\n    // handle validation error\r\n}\r\n```\r\n\r\n_Note_: The current implementation compares the POST value length using\r\n`strlen(Post::$var >= Post::$limit)` which resolves to a boolean.  Adjust for\r\nproper validation as needed.\r\n\r\n---\r\n\r\n## `core\\Auth`\r\n\r\nSimple session checker exposed as `Auth::user()`.\r\n",

Controllers can call this to handle\r\nunresolvable resources.\r\n\r\n```php\r\npublic function show(array $params): void\r\n{\r\n    if (!$model->exists($params[0] ?? null)) {\r\n        $this->error_404();\r\n        return;\r\n    }\r\n}\r\n```\r\n\r\n#### `is_auth(): void`\r\n\r\nRedirects to the `login` route when the current session lacks both `email` and\r\n`password` entries.\r\n\r\n```php\r\npublic function dashboard(): void\r\n{\r\n    $this->is_auth(); // redirect unauthenticated users\r\n    $this->view('dashboard');\r\n}\r\n```\r\n\r\n---\r\n\r\n## `core\\Post`\r\n\r\nUtility class for sanitising POST input with an optional minimum length\r\nconstraint.         "contents": "target method via `call_user_func_array`.  This method is invoked implicitly\r\nfrom `index.php`.\r\n\r\n**Dispatch Algorithm**\r\n\r\n1. Call `parseUrl()` to split `$_GET['url']` into path segments.\r\n2. Treat the first segment as controller name.  If the file\r\n   `app/controllers/<controller>.php` exists, set `$controller` accordingly.\r\n3. Include the controller file and instantiate the class.\r\n4. If the next segment matches a public method on the controller, select it.\r\n5. Any additional segments are passed to the method as a single array argument.\r\n\r\n```php\r\n// index.php\r\nrequire_once 'core/init.php';\r\n$app = new App(); // dispatches immediately\r\n```\r\n\r\n#### `parseUrl(): ?array`\r\n\r\nReads the `url` query parameter, trims trailing slashes, sanitises it with\r\n`FILTER_SANITIZE_URL`, and splits it into an array of segments.  Returns `null`\r\nwhen no `url` query string is provided.\r\n\r\n```php\r\n// Given: http://localhost/php-framework/html/show/123\r\n// $_GET['url'] === 'html/show/123'\r\n$segments = $app->parseUrl(); // ['html', 'show', '123']\r\n```\r\n\r\n### URL Routing Examples\r\n\r\n| URL path                                   | Controller | Method | Parameters (array)   |\r\n|--------------------------------------------|------------|--------|----------------------|\r\n| `/html/test1/params1/params2/params3`      | `html`     | `test1`| `['params1', â€¦]`     |\r\n| `/test1/params1/params2/params3`           | `html`     | `test1`| `['params1', â€¦]`     |\r\n| `/`                                        | `html`     | `index`| `[]`                  |\r\n\r\n_Note_: Controller filenames must be lowercase (`html.php`) while class names\r\nuse standard PHP casing (`Html`).\r\n\r\n---\r\n\r\n## `core\\Controller`\r\n\r\nBase class for application controllers located in `app/controllers`.  Extend\r\nthis class to gain access to view rendering and authentication helpers.\r\n\r\n### Public Methods\r\n\r\n#### `view(string $view, array $data = []): void`\r\n\r\n",

Layout files are stored in `app/views/layouts/`\r\n  - The view content is inserted into `$content` variable\r\n  - You can set a default layout in the controller with `protected $layout`\r\n  - Override layout per view by passing it as third parameter\r\n\r\n### CSRF\r\n#### Section: Adding CSRF Token to Forms\r\n- **Heading:** Adding CSRF Token to Forms\r\n- **Content:** Protect your forms from CSRF attacks by including a CSRF token.\r\n- **Code:**\r\n  ```html\r\n  <form method=\"POST\" action=\"<?= route('user.store') ?>\">\r\n      <?= csrf_field() ?>\r\n      \r\n      <input type=\"text\" name=\"name\" required>\r\n      <button type=\"submit\">Submit</button>\r\n  </form>\r\n  ```\r\n- **Explanation:**\r\n  - `csrf_field()`: Generates a hidden input with the CSRF token automatically\r\n  - The token is stored in the session and validated on each POST request\r\n  - If the token doesn't match, the request is rejected\r\n  - Tokens are regenerated periodically for security\r\n\r\n#### Section: Protecting Routes\r\n- **Heading:** Protecting Routes\r\n- **Content:** Add CSRF middleware to routes that handle form submissions.\r\n- **Code:**\r\n  ```php\r\n  <?php\r\n  \r\n  return [\r\n      'user.store' => [\r\n          'method' => 'POST',\r\n          'path' => '/user',\r\n          'controller' => 'user',\r\n          'action' => 'store',\r\n          'middleware' => ['csrf']  // CSRF protection\r\n      ],\r\n  ];\r\n  ```\r\n- **Explanation:**\r\n  - Add `'middleware' => ['csrf']` to protect routes\r\n  - Middleware runs before the controller action\r\n  - Automatically validates CSRF token for POST/PUT/DELETE requests\r\n\r\n### Upload\r\n#### Section: Handling File Uploads\r\n- **Heading:** Handling File Uploads\r\n- **Content:** Use the Upload class to handle file uploads with validation. Enhanced error handling in v2.0.0.\r\n- **Code:**\r\n  ```php\r\n  <?php\r\n  \r\n  use Core\\Upload;\r\n  use Core\\Logger;\r\n  \r\n  try {\r\n      $file = Upload::make('file')\r\n          ->allowed(['jpg', 'jpeg', 'png', 'pdf'])\r\n          ->maxSize(5242880) // 5MB in bytes\r\n          ->path('storage/uploads')\r\n          ->store();\r\n      \r\n      return $this->success([\r\n          'filename' => $file,\r\n          'url' => assets('uploads/' . $file)\r\n      ], 'File uploaded successfully');\r\n      \r\n  } catch (\\Exception $e) {\r\n      Logger::error(\"File upload failed\", ['error' => $e->getMessage()]);\r\n      return $this->error($e->getMessage(), 400);\r\n  }\r\n  ```\r\n- **Explanation:**\r\n  - `make('field')`: Specify the file input name from the form\r\n  - `allowed(['ext1', 'ext2'])`: Set allowed file extensions\r\n  - `maxSize(bytes)`: Set maximum file size (1MB = 1048576 bytes)\r\n  - `path('directory')`: Set upload directory relative to project root\r\n  - `store()`: Saves the file and returns the filename\r\n  - **New in v2.0.0:** Enhanced error handling with Logger integration\r\n\r\n## Notes\r\nThis version focuses on code quality, performance, and developer experience. All changes are backward compatible with v1.0.0.\r\n\r\n### Recent Fixes (Post-Release)\r\n- Fixed RewriteBase in .htaccess to resolve routing issues\r\n- Updated login controller method to properly accept router parameters\r\n\r\n"
